subtasks: Check soil moisture
Dig holes in the ground
Place tomato plants in holes
Cover roots with soil
Water the planted tomatoes
Dig rows in the ground
Place potato tubers in rows
Cover potatoes with soil
Press down soil around tubers
Locate carrot plants ready for harvest
Bend and grasp the carrot greens
Pull the carrots out of the ground
Collect harvested carrots in a basket or bag
Choose the type of irrigation system
Measure the required length of irrigation tubing
Cut irrigation tubing to appropriate lengths
Secure tubing to the garden frame
Connect emitters for water distribution
Lay out the irrigation system on the ground
bury the tubing for longevity and safety
Test the irrigation system for leaks and functionality
Identify areas around pumpkin plants needing compost
Collect compost from storage or pile
Spread compost evenly around pumpkin plants
Identify weeds around tomato plants
Use hand tools (e.g., trowel, hoe) to dig up weeds
Dispose of uprooted weeds properly
Ensure not to damage tomato roots during weeding
Identify squash plants that have grown too large
Determine areas where pruning is needed
Use pruning shears to cut excess vine growth
Dispose of pruned vines appropriately to prevent disease
Find a source of mulch, such as straw, leaves, or grass clippings
Spread mulch around corn stalks and plants
Ensure mulch is applied evenly and covers the base of plants
Avoid piling mulch too high, which could lead to rot
